title: Shocker (hand gesture)
text:
The shocker is a <a href="hand%20gesture">hand gesture</a> with a sexual connotation. The <a href="Index%20finger">index</a>, <a href="Middle%20finger">middle</a>, and <a href="Little%20finger">little fingers</a> are extended, while the <a href="ring%20finger">ring finger</a> is curled or bent down. The index and middle fingers are held together. The <a href="thumb">thumb</a> may be tucked against the palm or – in a variation on the gesture – extended.
The gesture refers to <a href="Fingering%20%28sexual%20act%29">the sex act</a> of inserting the <a href="index%20finger">index</a> and <a href="middle%20finger">middle finger</a>s into a partner's <a href="vagina">vagina</a> and the <a href="little%20finger">little finger</a> into their <a href="anus">anus</a>, the latter of which is presumed to "shock" them. If the thumb is extended, it refers to simultaneously stimulating their clitoris. The hand gesture is not necessarily practical for the sex act it represents, however. 
The standard form of the gesture is known <a href="colloquialism">colloquially</a> as "two in the pink, one in the stink", referring to the number of fingers inserted into the vagina and anus, respectively.
